text: pharmaceutical research plays an
important role in the drug Discovery
process companies invest billions of
dollars on research and Analysis however
to find key information researchers need
to comb through data from various
internal and external data sources they
need to separate quality data from noise
and they need to summarize and analyze
this data quickly while protecting the
data and adhering to regulatory
requirements a cws's AI powered
multi-agent solution addresses these
problems it helps researchers FastTrack
their research by autonomously combing
through millions of articles on PubMed
analyzing clinical trials searching
through molecular databases and
reasoning with the collected information
to understand the clinical and
scientific relevance of the problem
using generative AI services from AWS
like Amazon bedrock and capabilities
like agents for Bedrock life science
research can build an agent framework
that allows them to perform research and
take action across multimodal Healthcare
and life science data sources or action
groups let's walk through a practical
example of this imagine a researcher who
wants to create a comprehensive
scientific article about biomarker
guided breast
cancer as you can see in the query the
researcher is specifically interested in
biomarker information genetic
demographic and epidemiological
information
and breakthroughs that are currently in
Trials let's look at how our multi-agent
framework approaches this problem the
planner agent comes up with a plan
because the planner agent is aware of
what action groups are available it can
start mapping the steps to specific
action groups for example it uses the
PubMed Action Group to fetch information
from the literature about biomarkers
genetic subtypes and diagnosis it also
uses the clinical trials Action Group to
fetch information on relevant
trials next let's look at how the
executor agent executes the plan for
every step in the plan the executor
agent executes an API call with
appropriate API signatures and inputs
the planner agent then reviews the
output if the output meets the objective
of that step it moves on to the next
step if not the planner agent modifies
the plan by adding a new step to modify
the input or going to a different Action
Group with a different API signature an
input during this execution the executor
agent provides the raw output from the
action groups and the planner agent
interprets and suggests next steps that
the executor agent should take this
process repeats for each step until the
executor agent has all the information
needed to generate the final
report now it's time for the agent to
construct the final report to do this
the agent reviews all information
gathered in each of the previous steps
and puts that information into different
sections of the report for example it
creates sections for introduction
population characteristics breast cancer
subtypes and recommendations for future
trials it also puts summary information
in tables when necessary to represent
the data better the final report is
reviewed and presented to the researcher
in a markdown format by the
agent as you can see the multi-agent
solution looks at a variety of data sets
to generate this report the modular
nature of the agent's platform allows
you to extend it to multiple other
action groups to reference both internal
and external data sets typically the
creation of a report like this would
take a researcher multiple days of
searching through information and
curating it in a meaningful way however
by using the agent framework they can
save valuable time that can be spent
doing more meaningful
research leveraging AI powered Solutions
such as generative AI agents reduces the
time it takes for researchers to get
qualitative and quantitative data and
therefore reduces data fatigue and
decision
paralysis this gives researchers more
time to deeply analyze the observations
in the report add new data points and
improve the quality of their research
[Music]
